column4: any help with my problem? I tried to install Ubuntu 10.10, got to the Ubuntu screen with 5 red & white dots, then got a black screen, and nothing happens!
X session failed to load
what do you mean?
are you on a seperat computer from the one that failed to load?
yes
on the computer that failed to load fully press ctrl+alt+F1
does it put you at a terminal?
it's rebooting now, one moment
no, no change
so when it stalls you cant press that button set to get a terminal... that stinks
how old is the machine you are trying to install 10.10 on?
brand new, I did install windows 7 on a seperate partition
just so I can be clear you are trying to run the live boot and not the installer directly right?
sorry, what do you mean?  I downloaded the iso, put it into my computer, restarted, and it came up with the ubuntu logo and then a black screen
when the disk first starts to load it should have options " try Ubuntu without making changes" or "install ubuntu now"
did you just let it run out the timer?
no it just comes up with the ubuntu logo and the 5 dots
it starts with a little cannonical logo down the bottom, then the ubuntu logo
I tried the i386 iso, but it didn't boot off of that
well 10.04 is still out there and its the LTS "long Tearm Support" release you may have better luck with it
alright I'll have a look, thanks for your time
no prob
hey, thought I'd let you know the USB method worked - I think my laptop has a dodgy burner
